welcome.title: Welcome to the GlobalFleet Office help section.
welcome.content: In this section you will find all the information to use of all the features of GlobalFleet Office.

home.title: Home Screen
home.intro_text: On this home screen the application presents the summary of trips and the last known position of the devices with the Driver application installed.
home.new_trips_text: This widget shows information on the number of new trips that the system has received from the ERP and that have not yet been received on any device.
home.pending_trips_text: This widget shows information on the number of trips that are pending but have already been sent to the devices.
home.current_trips_text: This widget shows information on the number of trips in progress.
home.finished_trips_text: This widget shows information on the number of trips completed.
home.devices_text_1: This widget shows, on a map, the last known position of the devices with the Driver application installed. Each device is identified on the map with the GlobalFleet icon in green if the device is moving and in red if the device is stationary
home.devices_text_2: , furthermore, this icon shows the information of the name of the driver associated to this device and the direction in which they were driving at the moment of the positioning capture. The background is the colour
home.devices_text_3: of the trip status if this device has an associated trip; if this device does not have an associated trip, the background will be light grey.
home.devices_text_4: Clicking on the marker opens a screen where you can see in-depth information about the marker.
home.devices_text_5: In the top right of the map there is a selector to filter the content of the map to the selected device/driver.
home.devices_text_6: In the top left of the map there is a button to reload the map with the default values.
home.devices_li_1: A vehicle is deemed to be stationary when its speed is equal to or less than 5 km/h.
home.devices_li_2: The colours of the trip statuses are:

trips.title: Trips
trips.intro_text: On this trip screen the application displays a grid with the main data of the trips sorted by default by the ETA date of execution of the trip.
trips.intro_text_2: At the top of the screen there are a series of controls to filter, sort and search the trips shown.
trips.trips_filter: With this selector you can filter the display of the trips depending on their status.
trips.trips_order: With this selector you can sort the grid by the ETA date of the trip, by default, by the trip identifier, by the vehicle registration number or by the driver assigned to the trip.
trips.trips_search: This field lets you search for a trip by trip identifier, vehicle or driver associated with the trip.
trips.grid_text_1: The application then displays a grid with the most relevant information for each of the existing trips. Clicking on any trip will open a new window with in-detail information about the trip.
trips.info_alert_2: is automatically updated every 15 seconds, always showing the most up-to-date information in the system.

trip_details.title: Trip Details
trip_details.intro_text_1: On this trip details screen the application displays —in a timeline format— all the in-depth information about the selected trip. In this view you can check the status of each of the levels of the trip, the dates and times when each of the actions, stages and tasks have been carried out, as well as see the documents associated with the tasks.
trip_details.intro_text_2: On this screen you can also view and manage all the incidents related to the trip on screen and at all levels by clicking on the icon
trip_details.intro_text_3: at any level of the trip. If the icon is displayed in white in the trip header or in blue in the details it means that new incidents have been received, whereas if the icon is displayed in grey there are NO new incidents.

devices.title: Devices
devices.intro_text_1: On this screen of devices, the application displays the last known position of the devices with the Driver application installed. On the left side there is a list with the names of the drivers assigned to each device, with the GlobalFleet icon in green if the device is moving and in red if the device is stationary
devices.intro_text_2: , the name of the driver assigned to the device and the date and time of the last position update. On the right-hand side you will see the same information represented on the map. You can click on the driver's name in the list or on the marker on the map to see more in-depth information about the positioning log.
devices.intro_text_3: In the top right corner there is a button to access the device history screen.
